reviews.text: Stayed in the new wing (March 3rd - March 5th) but didn't get a look of the old rooms to compare.
reviews.title: Decent hotel but location might prove a problem for some

reviews.text: Room was clean, decent size and bed was western size though fairly firm. Got a sea view which was more of a side view but still salt water was within my panorama. Tea/coffee making facilities but no actual tea or coffee (bit odd). Bathroom fairly standard with the customary Hong Kong high pressure shower. Every shower I've used in Hong Kong blasts water at you which certainly wakes you up.
reviews.title: Great value in a lovely part of Lantau
Kind of scary when arriving past dark
reviews.text: Buffet breakfast was good. Quite a variety which changed a bit on the 2nd day so you wouldn't get too bored. A bit greasy (typically eggs, sausage, baked beans, hamburger, samosa) but there's cornflakes, toast and fruit for those who are health concious. Fresh tea and coffee available aswell fresh juice (I assume from concentrate). Forgot to mention but there's noodles too as a hot food choice.
The area is very quiet. Poor man's version of Stanley without the market is how I would describe it. Within a 5 minute walk there's McDonald's and 7-11.
reviews.title: Would only recommend if cost is biggest factor

reviews.text: Getting to the Silvermine proved to be our biggest problem. Waited at the bus stop outside the airport for nearly an hour and then some bus driver pulls up but only to tell us that there has been a crash and route is suspended until further notice. What should have been a cheap 60 minute journey turned into a 3 hour expensive detour via the airport express to Hong Kong station and then trying to find the ferry pier. All this is with our heavy luggage.
reviews.title: Great value
Great place to go...
reviews.text: The hotel is a really short walk from the Ferries that take 30 mins to Central and Tsim Sha Tsui and so is really just as convenient as being in a hotel in Kowloon that is still 40 mins from Central and in the middle of all the madness of town.

Mui Wo is a really quiet place - it's spotless and a real retreat from the sweaty hustle and bustle of the city. OK it's not got a throbbing nightlife, but if you're there to relax, with a few days to get across to Downtown to sightsee and to do the rest, it's perfect - if you're in a rush to "do" all of HK in a couple of days, it may be a little far out, but with a week to sightsee it;s perfect.
reviews.title: No Hong Kong craziness! Loved it!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed August 2006, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: After reading many of the other reviews i was VERY apprehensive about staying here - i even booked another hotel just in case the reviews where correct!
reviews.title: Surpassed expectations

likes.liked: — The staff's helpfulness and the room size
likes.disliked: — get a room in the new wing

reviews.title: I can only say WOW
reviews.text: The other reservation wasn't needed.

We stayed here for 4 days after an 8-week holiday to Europe and it was perfect for our needs, which was needing somewhere to relax and wind down but still good quaility. Yes, it is a long way from the airport but a fare of HK$150 is very cheap considering the exchange rate. And yes the taxi drivers are a bit erratic but that is part of the experience of going on holiday. They certainly weren't the worst taxi drivers we had on our trip. We got taxi's to and from and would do so again when we return here.
reviews.title: A reasonable place to stay

reviews.text: We got a room in the new wing. The room itself was HUGE in comparison with Europe hotel rooms, and very clean and tidy.
reviews.title: A Breath of Fresh Air in Hong Kong
What a shame
reviews.text: We had meals via room service and in the restuarant, both were very good quality and quantity. You will certainly never starve here.

reviews.title: really impressed
reviews.text: I am back packing and Hong Kong was my first stop. After seeing the usual places offered to backpackers and the prices of hotels in hong kong I picked the silvermine hotel. I am so glad I did. Mui Wo is a lovely little village with enough restaurants etc to keep you entertained in the evening. The ferry is a 5 min walk away and then it takes 30mins into central which is in the middle of the city. It costs 220HKD each way which is about 1.70 GBP. I saw Chunkking and Mirador mansions and am so glad I am staying here. The only bad thing is that it is difficult to meet other people so may be better for couples.

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed September 2006, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We have just returned from a four day stay at this hotel, we were doing this on the cheap so booked the cheapest room rate. Thanks to all the previous reviews we felt we booked this hotel, knowing not to expect too much.
reviews.title: Better Than We Expected, We Would Do It Again

likes.disliked: — no lifts. no safe beach front,

reviews.text: I would not recommend this place unless you're a cost-conscious backpacker or planning on a very short stay, and looking only for a place to sleep and if you are not planning on spending much time at the hotel.
reviews.title: Hotel is a little tired.

reviews.text: Recently spent four nights at the Silvermine. Agree with other reviewers that it is 'tired' but nevertheless can't beat it for location and peace and quiet. Staff all very friendly. Complimentary buffet breakfast more than adequate - lots of choices. You would never starve unless you were ultra fussy! We also enjoyed a dinner buffet on our last night. Again, lots of choices. The swimming pool and sauna were great. Room wise, very clean. Bed and pillows extremely firm! Took awhile to get used to this.
reviews.title: Great Value and Convenience

reviews.text: Made use of Internet on one occasion - one hour free on the purchase of a drink.
reviews.title: ideal place if you want peace and quiet

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed May 2007, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Myself and my Girlfirend stayed for 3 nights at the Silvermine only last week. We arrived tired from an early flight from Singapore and arrived at midday at the Silvermine. Any fears of not haing a room available at this time for us to get some much needed sleep were quickly dashed upon arrival. Not only was there a room ready and waiting for us we were also upgraded free of charge to a room in the hotels new wing. Excellent customer service or what!?
reviews.title: Service with a smile!

reviews.text: The room itself was average in size and offered a part view of the beach. Room was clean as was ensuite. Some facilites in room perhaps lacking. No coffee or 'western' teas bags on offer and only limited TV choice.
reviews.title: Cheap value, old-style HongKong

reviews.text: The hotel also had a large swimming pool in its grounds, though we never had chance to use it. Breakfast was inlcuded in price and was overall so-so. Wide range of foods on offer though quality not as good as would have liked.
reviews.title: The slower side of Hong Kong with easy access to the city
a bargain - will return
reviews.text: We did eat in their restaurant on our first night and their evening buffet fared a little better than breakfast. The food was of good quality and deal included unlimited beer.

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed March 2007, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Once you have gotten used to the idea of not staying in Central Hong Kong, the location of the Silvermine is handy enough for the towns few attractions. Mo Wui itself is ok. There are a few restaurants (including ubiquitous McDonalds) and shops nearby. Try the local pizzeria restaurant in the town square, excellent food at reasonable prices.
reviews.title: Hong Kong Oasis

reviews.text: We stayed here for 2 nights and 2 days at this hotel.
reviews.title: Quiet (&Quaint) isolated place

likes.liked: — Beautiful scenic quiet place tucked in a small village
likes.disliked: — Too far from the main attraction, not easy commute

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed February 2007, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We were a party of 3 including a 4 month old infant, on our first ever trip to Hongkong. Personally, I liked the solitude and settings of the hotel, just across a very quiet & lovely beach.
reviews.title: Very Jaded

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed November 2006, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Staff was very friendly. We got a room, garden facing, with 2 twin beds. Heater, running hot water and mattress were okay. No complaint about the facilities.
reviews.title: Will be back
